    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, you know these are the finest apples in all of Fruitville. Surely, you can see the value in such a prize crop.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these are fine apples, no doubt, but six coins is a steep price. I'd be happy to take them off your hands for four.

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 4 coins

          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.


          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is trying to buy peaches from Lennon Figtree at a good price so she can resell them for a profit in her hometown. They are currently negotiating the price.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, these peaches are beautiful, but I'm running a business here. I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these peaches are the finest in Fruitville. Surely you can give me a better price than that.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

          Question: What kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a savvy and driven businesswoman.

          Question: What kind of situation is Della Plumstone in right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

          Plan: [07:00 - 08:00] Continue negotiating with Lennon Figtree, aiming to secure the peaches at a price that allows for a healthy profit margin.
          [08:00 - 09:00] Purchase the peaches at the agreed-upon price, carefully inspecting the quality and quantity to ensure she receives what she paid for.
          [09:00 - 10:00] Transport the peaches back to her wagon, ensuring they are securely stored to prevent bruising.
          [10:00 - 12:00] Set up her stall in the marketplace, attractively displaying the peaches and pricing them competitively.
          [12:00 - 13:00] Take a break for lunch, perhaps enjoying a simple meal from a local vendor.
          [13:00 - 17:00] Actively sell the peaches to customers, using her persuasive skills and knowledge of fruit to highlight their quality and freshness.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Pack up any remaining peaches and prepare to depart Fruitville.
          [18:00] Begin her journey back to her home town, eager to capitalize on the profitable transaction.

          Current time: 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 5 coins
          (b) 1 coin
          (c) 3 coins
          (d) 2 coins
          (e) 4 coins
          Answer: (e)

          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about we say 2 coins for the lot? That's a fair price, considering their quality.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a tough negotiator.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, you know these are the finest apples in all of Fruitville. Surely, you can see the value in such a prize crop.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these are fine apples, no doubt, but six coins is a steep price. I'd be happy to take them off your hands for four.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose.           [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, these peaches are beautiful, but I'm running a business here. I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these peaches are the finest in Fruitville. Surely you can give me a better price than that.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a shrewd, ambitious, and determined businesswoman.
          current daily occupation: a traveling fruit merchant.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling very satisfied with her progress.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a savvy and driven businesswoman.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [07:00 - 08:00] Continue negotiating with Lennon Figtree, aiming to secure the peaches at a price that allows for a healthy profit margin.
          [08:00 - 09:00] Purchase the peaches at the agreed-upon price, carefully inspecting the quality and quantity to ensure she receives what she paid for.
          [09:00 - 10:00] Transport the peaches back to her wagon, ensuring they are securely stored to prevent bruising.
          [10:00 - 12:00] Set up her stall in the marketplace, attractively displaying the peaches and pricing them competitively.
          [12:00 - 13:00] Take a break for lunch, perhaps enjoying a simple meal from a local vendor.
          [13:00 - 17:00] Actively sell the peaches to customers, using her persuasive skills and knowledge of fruit to highlight their quality and freshness.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Pack up any remaining peaches and prepare to depart Fruitville.
          [18:00] Begin her journey back to her home town, eager to capitalize on the profitable transaction.

      Stage index

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a fruit seller in Fruitville who is currently negotiating the price of peaches with Della Plumstone. Della has offered 4 coins for the peaches.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to reject Della Plumstone's offer.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville. I can't just give them away.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, surely we can come to a fairer price than that. These peaches are lovely, but I need to be able to make a profit when I sell them back home.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about we say 2 coins for the lot? That's a fair price, considering their quality.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, you know these are the finest apples in all of Fruitville. Surely, you can see the value in such a prize crop.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these are fine apples, no doubt, but six coins is a steep price. I'd be happy to take them off your hands for four.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke.           Current time: 1895-09-15 00:10:00.


          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is a fruit seller in Fruitville who is currently negotiating the price of peaches with Della Plumstone. Della has offered 4 coins for the peaches.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these peaches are the finest in Fruitville. Surely you can give me a better price than that.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, these peaches are beautiful, but I'm running a business here. I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 4 coins or reject it.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to reject Della Plumstone's offer.
          Time
        • 1895-09-15 00:10:00

          Query

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is a fruit seller in Fruitville who is currently negotiating the price of peaches with Della Plumstone. Della has offered 4 coins for the peaches.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these peaches are the finest in Fruitville. Surely you can give me a better price than that.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, these peaches are beautiful, but I'm running a business here. I need to make a profit when I sell them back home.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 4 coins or reject it.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to reject Della Plumstone's offer.

          Question: Would Lennon Figtree accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (b)

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 4 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.


          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the Fruitville market trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook at a price that will allow her to make a profit when she resells them. She is currently considering his offer of 3 coins per peach.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality of your peaches, but I need to be able to make a decent profit when I sell them back home.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Della. How about 3 coins a peach? That's a good price considering their quality.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.

          Question: What kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman.

          Question: What kind of situation is Della Plumstone in right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

          Plan: [07:00 - 08:00] Continue negotiating with Lennon Figtree, aiming to secure the peaches at a price that allows for a healthy profit margin.
          [08:00 - 09:00] Purchase the peaches at the agreed-upon price, carefully inspecting the quality and quantity to ensure she receives what she paid for.
          [09:00 - 10:00] Transport the peaches back to her wagon, ensuring they are securely stored to prevent bruising.
          [10:00 - 12:00] Set up her stall in the marketplace, attractively displaying the peaches and pricing them competitively.
          [12:00 - 13:00] Take a break for lunch, perhaps enjoying a simple meal from a local vendor.
          [13:00 - 17:00] Actively sell the peaches to customers, using her persuasive skills and knowledge of fruit to highlight their quality and freshness.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Pack up any remaining peaches and prepare to depart Fruitville.
          [18:00] Begin her journey back to her home town, eager to capitalize on the profitable transaction.

          Current time: 16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 1 coin
          (b) 2 coins
          (c) 5 coins
          (d) 3 coins
          (e) 4 coins
          Answer: (e)

They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a savvy and driven businesswoman.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality of your peaches, but I need to be able to make a decent profit when I sell them back home.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Della. How about 3 coins a peach? That's a good price considering their quality.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a traveling fruit merchant.
          core characteristics: a shrewd, ambitious, and driven businesswoman.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling quite satisfied with her progress.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a shrewd and ambitious businesswoman.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Della Plumstone's The current date/time is:
          16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is at the Fruitville market negotiating the price of peaches with Cedric Meadowbrook. She wants to buy them at a price that will allow her to resell them for a profit. Cedric is currently offering 3 coins per peach.
          Query
        • Della Plumstone, Della Plumstone is at the Fruitville market negotiating the price of peaches with Cedric Meadowbrook. She wants to buy them at a price that will allow her to resell them for a profit. Cedric is currently offering 3 coins per peach.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [07:00 - 08:00] Continue negotiating with Lennon Figtree, aiming to secure the peaches at a price that allows for a healthy profit margin.
          [08:00 - 09:00] Purchase the peaches at the agreed-upon price, carefully inspecting the quality and quantity to ensure she receives what she paid for.
          [09:00 - 10:00] Transport the peaches back to her wagon, ensuring they are securely stored to prevent bruising.
          [10:00 - 12:00] Set up her stall in the marketplace, attractively displaying the peaches and pricing them competitively.
          [12:00 - 13:00] Take a break for lunch, perhaps enjoying a simple meal from a local vendor.
          [13:00 - 17:00] Actively sell the peaches to customers, using her persuasive skills and knowledge of fruit to highlight their quality and freshness.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Pack up any remaining peaches and prepare to depart Fruitville.
          [18:00] Begin her journey back to her home town, eager to capitalize on the profitable transaction.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: accept
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • accept
      Context for action selection and components
      • ObservationSummary
      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell peaches to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market. Della has offered 4 coins per peach, but Cedric previously countered with 3 coins per peach.
          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          ['[16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.', '[16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality of your peaches, but I need to be able to make a decent profit when I sell them back home.', '[16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Della.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell peaches to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market. Della has offered 4 coins per peach, but Cedric previously countered with 3 coins per peach.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer of 4 coins per peach.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke.           [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, surely we can come to a fairer price than that. These peaches are lovely, but I need to be able to make a profit when I sell them back home.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about we say 2 coins for the lot? That's a fair price, considering their quality.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins

          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these peaches are the finest in Fruitville. Surely you can give me a better price than that.

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell peaches to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market. Della has offered 4 coins per peach, but Cedric previously countered with 3 coins per peach.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality of your peaches, but I need to be able to make a decent profit when I sell them back home.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 4 coins per peach or reject it.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer of 4 coins per peach.

          16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is negotiating the price of peaches with Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market. Della offered 4 coins per peach, while Cedric countered with 3 coins per peach.
          Query
        • Cedric Meadowbrook, Cedric Meadowbrook is negotiating the price of peaches with Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market. Della offered 4 coins per peach, while Cedric countered with 3 coins per peach.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Cedric Meadowbrook to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, he accompanied his father on a trading expedition to a distant village. He was tasked with selling apples to the villagers, a responsibility that filled him with both excitement and trepidation. He learned the importance of building relationships, of understanding the needs of his customers, and of always offering a fair price.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 4 coins per peach or reject it.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer of 4 coins per peach.

          (a) reject
          (b) accept

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed 2 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed 2 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: 2 coins
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • 2 coins

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price, with Lennon hoping to get a good deal to resell the peaches in her hometown.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.

          Answer

Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "How much for a bushel of your finest peaches?
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well now, Lennon, these peaches are particularly fine this year. I'd be lookin' for at least 3 coins a bushel.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-17 00:10:00.


          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price, with Lennon hoping to get a good deal to resell the peaches in her hometown.

          Recalled memories and observations: [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "How much for a bushel of your finest peaches?
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well now, Lennon, these peaches are particularly fine this year. I'd be lookin' for at least 3 coins a bushel.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the peaches.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the peaches, aiming for a price that allows for a profit when resold in her hometown.

        • 1895-09-17 00:10:00

          Query

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 17 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price, with Lennon hoping to get a good deal to resell the peaches in her hometown.

          Recalled memories and observations: [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "How much for a bushel of your finest peaches?
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well now, Lennon, these peaches are particularly fine this year. I'd be lookin' for at least 3 coins a bushel.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the peaches.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the peaches, aiming for a price that allows for a profit when resold in her hometown.

          Question: What price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) 4 coins
          (b) 2 coins
          (c) 3 coins
          (d) 1 coin
          (e) 5 coins
          Answer: (b)

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: accept

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, surely we can come to a fairer price than that. These peaches are lovely, but I need to be able to make a profit when I sell them back home.

          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well now, Lennon, these peaches are particularly fine this year. I'd be lookin' for at least 3 coins a bushel.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept or reject Lennon Figtree's offer of 2 coins.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to reject Lennon Figtree's offer.

          Statements:
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, he accompanied his father on a trading expedition to a distant village. He was tasked with selling apples to the villagers, a responsibility that filled him with both excitement and trepidation. He learned the importance of building relationships, of understanding the needs of his customers, and of always offering a fair price.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he made his first solo trading trip, venturing to a neighboring town with a cart full of plums. He faced his first real setback when a sudden illness forced him to halt his journey for several days. Undeterred, Cedric persevered, bartering his plums for medicine and supplies, and eventually reaching his destination, albeit delayed.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.

          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Della. How about 3 coins a peach? That's a good price considering their quality.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well now, Lennon, these peaches are particularly fine this year. I'd be lookin' for at least 3 coins a bushel.

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
